level.text: When any part of the record in any other proceeding before the Board, a criminal or civil action, or a proceeding before any administrative agency is offered in evidence, a certified true copy of that part of that record shall be presented to the Board as an exhibit, except in the following instances:
It is described in a manner which makes it readily identifiable and the offeror agrees to supply copies at a later time as required by the Board;
There is a stipulation on the record that it may be incorporated by reference and the Board directs the incorporation; or
It is described in a manner which makes it readily identifiable in the files of the Board.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 51 DCR 4309 (April 30, 2004); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 55 DCR 12991 (December 26, 2008).
